events.title: "Who's Flying This Thing?" Thoughts on U.S. Military Action in Venezuela, the “Donroe” Doctrine, and U.S. Relations With Latin America
events.organizer: Institute of International Studies, Goldman School of Public Policy
events.description: A discussion led by Ambassador Feeley on U.S. military action in Venezuela and U.S. relations with Latin America, offering critical observations from a career in federal service.

events.title: Dr. Kevin Bustamante: The Myth of Nuclear Prestige
events.organizer: Goldman School of Public Policy, Berkeley Risk and Security Lab
events.description: Dr. Kevin Bustamante discusses his research on the role of nuclear weapons as international status symbols, drawing on the sociology of fashion and using case studies and computational text analysis.

events.title: Venezuela in Context: A Q&A on Policy and the US Military
events.location: GSPP Room 105 and via Zoom, UC Berkeley
events.description: A Q&A session in partnership with Professor Dorothy Kronick to deepen understanding of current developments in Venezuela by examining its historical political institutions and policy implications.

events.title: Focus On Local and State Government: Master of Public Affairs (MPA) Information Session
events.description: An information session for prospective students interested in the Master of Public Affairs program, with a focus on careers in local and state government.

events.title: Dr. Maxime Polleri: Radioactive Governance: The Politics of Revitalization in Post-Fukushima Japan
events.organizer: Goldman School of Public Policy, Berkeley Risk and Security Lab
events.description: Dr. Maxime Polleri examines how Japanese political elites have promoted a politics of recovery after the Fukushima meltdown, emphasizing assurances of minimal radiation dangers and a resilient mindset.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: Evolving Conditions
events.organizer: UC Berkeley School of Law (presented by GSPP)
events.description: The first in the Clark Kerr Lectures series, with President Eisgruber focusing on major trends that have affected the American model of the research university, including rising student debt and national competition.

events.title: MPA Career Services Overview & Alumni Panel
events.description: An overview of career services available to Master of Public Affairs students, followed by a panel discussion featuring alumni sharing their professional experiences.

events.title: New Manager Boot Camp
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person intensive boot camp designed for new managers to develop essential leadership and management skills.

events.title: High-Impact Leadership Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program focusing on developing high-impact leadership capabilities for experienced professionals.

events.title: The Berkeley Executive Leadership Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 5-day in-person executive program designed to enhance the leadership skills of senior executives and prepare them for complex organizational challenges.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: Contested Missions
events.organizer: UC Berkeley School of Law (presented by GSPP)
events.description: The second lecture in the Clark Kerr series, with President Eisgruber examining the role of university presidents, the civic mission of American research universities, and how university communities should respond to challenges.

events.title: Master of Public Affairs (MPA) Information Session
events.description: Another opportunity for prospective students to learn more about the Master of Public Affairs program at the Goldman School of Public Policy.

events.title: Negotiation and Influence Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program to equip participants with effective negotiation strategies and influence tactics for various professional scenarios.

events.title: Product Management Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 5-day in-person program covering the essentials of product management, from strategy and development to launch and lifecycle.

events.title: Envisioning Awe-filled Schools and Classrooms
events.organizer: Greater Good Science Center at UC Berkeley
events.description: Three 90-minute facilitated sessions (first on 04-07) exploring the science of awe and its application in educational settings, part of the Greater Good Educators Program.

events.title: Leading Strategy Execution through Culture Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 2-day in-person program focusing on how to effectively lead the execution of organizational strategies by leveraging and shaping company culture.

events.title: Venture Capital Executive Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 5-day in-person executive program offering deep insights into the venture capital industry, ideal for investors, entrepreneurs, and corporate strategists.

events.title: Leadership Communications Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program designed to enhance leadership communication skills for impactful interactions and presentations.

events.title: The Berkeley Changemaker Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program fostering innovative thinking, problem-solving, and leadership aligned with Berkeley's Changemaker philosophy.

events.title: AI for Executives Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program tailored for executives to understand and leverage artificial intelligence for business strategy and innovation.

events.title: Storytelling for Financial Leaders Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 3-day in-person program focusing on developing compelling storytelling skills essential for financial leaders to effectively communicate complex data and strategies.

events.title: Negotiation and Strategic Business Interactions Program
events.organizer: Berkeley Executive Education, Haas School of Business
events.description: A 1-day in-person intensive program designed to enhance skills in high-stakes negotiation and strategic business interactions.
